result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin J. Von Behren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Austin J. Von Behren is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Austin J. Von Behren was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  Submit to any treatment recommendations or assessment recommendations requested by the agent.  Pay costs.  (If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.)
Concurrent with: sentence being served

records.addlTxt: Per the local P/P office, the DOC rescinded the discharge letter in this case. "The extension was signed by the Court prior to the discharge date, however, we (DOC) did not receive it until later. His case has been extended."

Clerk has inquired with local P/P as to why Defendant was discharged when there was a signed Order Extending Probation issued by Judge Sharp 7/20/18. Agent TS is looking into this. In the meantime, that order has been forwarded to the agent. If there are problems, agent will communicate with the Court.

Def's waiver of right to appear in person for sentencing

Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant Austin J. Von Behren. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Austin J. Von Behren appeared by phone means (video connection is not working and defense has approved def's appearance by phone).  DA states the agreement of the parties - Def to plea to Count 1 for probation of 3 years, concurrent with current sentence with conditions of treatment/assts at recommendation of agent, plus costs.  Court conducts, with def, waiver of Def's right to appear by person (State v. Soto).  Def waives his right to be present for this hearing.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Court follows jt recommendation and orders sentence withheld for 3 years probation.  Conditions:  follow treatment recomms of agent and treatment options, and costs.  Firearms admonishment provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-07-2015 02:00 pm

Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant Austin J. Von Behren. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Requests matter be set for plea & sentencing as parties are working toward resolution. Def may appear via video if he is willing and waives his right to appear.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
